name: FurnaceInventory
description: The FurnaceInventory class is a specialized inventory helper that provides access to Minecraft furnace screen functionality.
overview:
The `FurnaceInventory` represents the interface to a Minecraft furnace when its GUI is open. It provides access to furnace-specific operations such as checking if items and fuels can be smelted together, monitoring smelting progress and fuel levels, accessing input/fuel/output slots, validating smelting recipes, and getting comprehensive fuel value information.

Key Features:
- Fuel validation and comprehensive fuel value lookup
- Smelting progress tracking with time calculations
- Individual slot access for input, fuel, and output
- Recipe validation for smeltable items
- Integration with standard inventory operations
- Support for all furnace types (regular furnace, blast furnace, smoker)

methods.name: getSmeltedItem
methods.description: Returns the item stack in the input slot (slot 0, top left). This is where items to be smelted are placed.

methods.name: getFuel
methods.description: Returns the item stack in the fuel slot (slot 1, bottom left). This is where fuel items like coal, charcoal, wood, or lava buckets are placed.

methods.name: getInput
methods.description: Returns the item stack in the input slot at the specified position. For furnaces, this always returns the input slot regardless of the x, y parameters (which are ignored and should be 0, 0).

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The x position of the input (will always be 0)

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: The y position of the input (will always be 0)

methods.name: canUseAsFuel
methods.description: Returns true if the given item can be used as fuel in a furnace, false otherwise.

methods.name: isSmeltable
methods.description: Returns true if the given item can be smelted in a furnace, false otherwise.

methods.name: getFuelValues
methods.description: Returns a map containing all valid fuel items and their burn times in ticks. The map keys are item IDs and values are burn times.

methods.name: getSmeltingProgress
methods.description: Returns the current smelting progress in ticks. If this equals getTotalSmeltingTime(), the item is finished smelting. Returns 0 if no smelting is in progress.

methods.name: getTotalSmeltingTime
methods.description: Returns the total smelting time required for the current input item in ticks.

methods.name: getRemainingSmeltingTime
methods.description: Returns the remaining time until the current smelting operation completes, in ticks. If no smelting is in progress, returns the full smelting time.

methods.name: getRemainingFuelTime
methods.description: Returns the remaining burn time for the current fuel item in ticks. Returns 0 when no fuel is remaining.

methods.name: getTotalFuelTime
methods.description: Returns the total burn time of the current fuel item in ticks. This represents how long the current fuel item can burn when first placed in the furnace.

methods.name: isBurning
methods.description: Returns true if the furnace is currently burning (has fuel and is actively smelting), false otherwise.

methods.name: getOutput
methods.description: Returns the item stack in the output slot (slot 2, right side). This contains the smelted items.

methods.name: getCraftableRecipes
methods.description: Returns a list of recipes that can be crafted with the current input. For furnaces, this will show smelting recipes for the current input item.

methods.name: getRecipes
methods.description: Returns a list of recipes available in this furnace. When craftable is true, only returns recipes that can be made with current inputs.

parameters.name: craftable
parameters.description: Whether to only return craftable recipes
